matches.explanation: Exact match: Red Team's 'Uses S3-managed keys (SSE-S3) instead of KMS keys (SSE-KMS) which provide better control and audit capabilities for PHI data' on aws_s3_bucket_server_side_encryption_configuration.phi_storage was detected as 'Weak encryption configuration for PHI data' on aws_s3_bucket_server_side_encryption_configuration.phi_storage

Exact match: Red Team's 'Allows any authenticated AWS user to read PHI data, violating HIPAA minimum necessary access requirement' on aws_s3_bucket_acl.phi_storage was detected as 'Overly permissive S3 bucket ACL' on aws_s3_bucket_acl.phi_storage
No matching finding for vulnerability: No access logging configured for PHI data, required for HIPAA compliance audit trails

Partial match: Red Team's 'Overly permissive KMS key policy allows any IAM principal in account to manage key' on aws_kms_key.phi_encryption_key was partially detected as 'Overly permissive KMS key policy' on aws_kms_key.phi_encryption_key

Exact match: Red Team's 'Versioning disabled while delete permissions are allowed creates risk of permanent PHI loss' on aws_s3_bucket_versioning.phi_storage was detected as 'S3 bucket versioning disabled for PHI data' on aws_s3_bucket_versioning.phi_storage
